title: Drawing, "Section of the Portico, Santa Maria Maggiore, Rome", 1740–41
medium:
Graphite, black ink
Support: cream laid paper
provenance: Ex-Collection: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward Brandegee, Boston.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Design shows wall elevation consisting of four doorways supported by a pair of pilasters. Greater in height than the others, the third doorway from the left has two pediments: a triangular inner one, and a rounded broken outer one. Surmounting this doorway is a lunette, with two sculpted cherubs bearing a roundel. Other lunettes of masks and garlands appear above other portals. Details of ceiling decorations at top.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Section of the Portico, Santa Maria Maggiore, Rome", 1740–41.
1740–41. Graphite, black ink
Support: cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-4597.
